name: Flagland - Love Hard
description: Love Hard is Flagland’s third album, and at twenty tracks, speaks volumes to the Brooklyn trio's songwriting stamina and dedication to doing things on their own terms. The recording process was piecemeal, done sporadically by the band between shows, and with the exception of drums at Let ‘Em In Music in Brooklyn, was recorded and mixed in Dooley’s apartment. The themes weaving throughout Love Hard can be summed up with a few key words: Love hard. Fight hard. Live hard. The same can be said for the variance of musical styles. Equal amounts of ferocity are heard on the bipolar “Comfortable Life” and bleak, hard-hitting “Monster,” as on their musical antithesis, the jubilant power-pop “Sugarcube.” Flagland is a multi-dimensional band that is impossible to label or define. Everything is open to interpretation. Love Hard will be released February 25, 2014.

name: Running In The Fog - Silver (DIGITAL)
description: Running In The Fog is the moniker of San Francisco’s Amanda Harper. Harper’s deep seeded affinity for ‘90s R&B sets the scene for the project’s self-penned soul-infused space pop. Spending the better part of her adolescence singing and playing saxophone in jazz outfits, followed by a cross-country journey that took her to Philadelphia to study music and theater, her eclectic inspirations can be heard throughout everything she touches. On Silver, the six alluring tracks spotlight Harper’s silky vocals and hypnotic production. Silver is out December 10, 2013.

name: Body Parts - Fire Dream
description:
Body Parts mobilizes a singularly elegant experimental pop idiom to explore the contours of modern devotion and doctrines of self-improvement alongside the immoderate reverberations of remembrance. Weaving together influences as varied as the rationalist prescriptions of the self-made seeker-healer- Scientology mastermind L. Ron Hubbard, the sensual guitar-scapes of Prince, and the haunting vocals and surrealist melodrama of Kate Bush, Ryder Bach and Alina Cutrono form the group’s core.

Vinyl orders come with an instant digital download. Domestic orders are shipped via USPS Media Mail. International orders ship via First Class International.



Track Listing
1. Desperation
2. Past is Coming
3. Be A God
4. Interlude a
5. Unavoidable Things
6. Helpless Child
7. People
8. Interlude b
9. You Inside My Head
10. Reprise, Prelude
11. Wash Over Me

"...epic and hopelessly catchy" - Pigeons and Planes

"...polychromatic pop that thematically reaches beyond the mere calisthenics in ’80s textures done by a lot bands like them" - Buzzbands

"the meeting point of bright, '80s dance music and the subconscious" - Interview Magazine

"Textures of electronic experimentation as lush and vibrant as a fresh carton of raspberries that are immediately dropped into a champagne flute." - Impose

name: Pure Bathing Culture T-shirt
description: Exclusive Pure Bathing Culture design only available from Father/Daughter. Illustration by Jess Rotter at Rotter & Friends. Silkscreened on American Apparel 50/50 Unisex Crew Neck. ** WHEN ORDERED IN CONJUNCTION WITH A RECORD, PACKAGE SHIPS DOMESTIC USPS PRIORITY MAIL! **

name: Bent Shapes - Feels Weird
description:
Bent Shapes is Andy Sadoway, Ben Potrykus, and Supriya Gunda. Since forming under the name Girlfriends in 2009, the Boston trio has released a string of cassettes and 7”s full of fuzzy garage, frantic jangle pop, and scrappy post-punk on various labels (including band members’ own imprints). The band’s myriad of influences reference touchstones like Josef K, The Feelies, Jonathan Richman, Billy Childish, and The Fall.

Vinyl orders come with a digital download & 11x17 poster. Domestic orders are shipped via USPS Media Mail. International orders ship via First Class International.

Buy Digital

1. Behead Yrself, Pt. 2
2. Leave It 'Til You Need It
3. Panel Of Experts
4. Brat Poison
5. What Do You Get??
6. Hex Maneuvers
7. Big Machines
8. Bites And Scratches
9. Check My Vitals!!
10. Boys To Men
11. I Was Here But I Disappear

"...it's hard to bemoan Bent Shapes' knack for marrying lyricism and melody" - Pitchfork

"... tight, hummable melodies to ramshackle garage sprawl" - Spin Magazine

"...an essential no-filler record with some of the best indie pop songwriting you’ll hear all year" - Stereogum

name: The Everywheres LP
description:
The self-titled debut from songwriter Samuel Hill's The Everywheres, summons scrappy yet masterful psych-pop. Hill started making music as The Everywheres in the summer of 2012. The notorious drifter found himself back in his native Halifax, Nova Scotia, more specifically in the basement of his childhood home. Glowing garlands take shape from a cocktail of Davies odes, Brian Jonestown candidness and nomadic adventures. Swirling guitar wanes smooth to build a delicate, jewel-toned backbone from which peyote induced tambourines and blissed-out harmonies stem.

All vinyl orders come with an instant digital download. Domestic orders are shipped via USPS Media Mail. International orders ship via First Class International.



Buy Digital

The Everywheres Track Listing
1. Unfortunate Direction
2. Someone Disappeared
3. Other State
4. Watch it Grow
5. Cold Curator Sings
6. Strangers Below the Wire
7. Easy Bells
8. Weekend Yellows

name: Saskatchewan - Occasion (DIGITAL LP)
description:
Saskatchewan began as the project of Orlando, Florida based multi-instrumentalist Chandler Strang, whose inspiration was culled from the passion and intensity of muses like Tears for Fears and Phil Collins. Strang began collaborating with several other Orlando based musicians to further develop the dreamy aesthetic of his initial solo material. After the release of several EPs, the now full-fledged band, who has toured with Gauntlet Hair, Mister Heavenly, Hundred Waters, and Levek, amongst others, has released their debut album, Occasion.

Occasion Track Listing
1. Death & Taxes
2. Divine Kind
3. Possession
4. Spellbound
5. Destroy
6. Youth Ministry
7. Fronting
8. New Medicine
9. Venom
10. Occasion

name: Cocktails - Cocktails 7"
description:
Cocktails, San Francisco’s best kept after hours secret, have finally stepped into the sunlight with their new 4-song self-titled EP. Recorded over three days in the summer of 2012 at Fuzz City with Matthew Melton and Rob Good (of Bay Area bands Warm Soda and Bare Wires,) Cocktails is the first official offering from the self described “slop pop” quartet.

Their energetic power-pop punch hits somewhere between late 70s punk and fuzzed out 90s alt (think Teenage Fanclub or GBV anthems combined with the disarming honesty and pent-up aggression of This Year’s Model era Elvis Costello). They crank out big melodies, loud guitars, and loads of sticky sweet boy/girl vocal harmonies that will surely kick some pep into your step. 150 records pressed on "blonde" wax.

Vinyl orders come with a digital download and are shipped 2-4 business days from date of purchase. Domestic orders are shipped via USPS First Class Mail. International orders ship via First Class International.



Buy Digitally

Cocktails Track Listing
1. No Blondes (In California)
2. Hey Winnie
3. Willowbrook Lane
4. Tear It To Pieces

name: Leapling - Losing Face 10" EP
description:
Losing Face is the debut 5-song EP from Brooklyn, NY quartet, Leapling. The packaging, including a gorgeous full color insert, was created & designed by Providence, RI artist Jenny Brown.

Leapling began as home recordings, written by singer/guitarist Dan Arnes over the course of several months. From there, Dan and drummer, Yoni David, edited the tracks down to what would ultimately become Losing Face and also assembled a live band, which includes bassist R.J. Gordon (who also mastered the EP) and Joey Postiglione on lead guitar. The project is fairly new to the scene but the players are not -- they are the hearts and minds behind the Bushwick DIY venue/art space Big Snow Buffalo Lodge and the artist collective known as American Buffalo Recordings. You'd be hard pressed to find a group of people more committed to the local music community than these four dudes. Since their inception in early 2012, Leapling has performed live with friends and comrades Twin Sister, Ava Luna, Each Other and Total Slacker.

Vinyl orders come with a digital download and are shipped 2-3 business days from date of purchase. Domestic orders are shipped via USPS Media Mail. International orders ship via First Class International.

Buy Digitally

Losing Face Tracklisting
1. Nature Must Not Win
2. Memory Bank
3. Fantastic, Fleeting and Out of Reach
4. If You're Patient
5. June

name: Audiophile button
description: Pin this bad boy to your favorite denim accessory and show off your hardcore audiophile pride. 1" round button printed on metallic stock.

name: Father/Daughter Records Sticker
description: Show the world how much you love Father/Daughter with this 3" x 3" circle sticker, printed on high-quality UV coated vinyl.

name: Pure Bathing Culture - S/T 12" EP
description:
Daniel Hindman and Sarah Versprille began writing songs together in 2009. In 2011, the duo packed up their lives, moved to Portland, OR and realized that it was time to put a name to the new project -- Pure Bathing Culture was born. Through various serendipitous connections, multi-instrumentalist and producer Richard Swift heard their early demos and immediately invited them to record with him at his National Freedom studio in Cottage Grove, OR. On Pure Bathing Culture's debut S/T EP, their elegantly smooth pop melodies embody the nostalgia of soft 80s pop with a freshness all its own.

Buy Digitally WATCH: "IVORY COAST" OFFICIAL MUSIC VIDEO



TRACK LISTING
1. Lucky One
2. Silver Shores Lake
3. Ivory Coast
4. Gainesville

"There's something about the lead song...that glowers like a grey English afternoon, the dejected guitar lines stinging like the watery rods that poured through the Sundays' Reading, Writing, and Arithmetic." -- Pitchfork

"I dare you to escape the entrancing charms of "Lucky One" without hitting the repeat button" -- Portland Mercury

name: Oregon Bike Trails (now Cayucas) - High School Lover 7"
description:
High School Lover is the new 7" from Santa Monica, CA's Oregon Bike Trails (now Cayucas). Zach Yudin originally created OBT as a solo project but has since expanded to a full band. The bass-y strut on "High School Lover" gets your head bobbing and at the same time, recalls a certain nostalgic nod to 50s/60s era pop songs. The B-Side "Cayucas" is a previously unreleased track that is sure to bring back fond memories of summer when you're holed up in your apartment in winter.

The 7" is hand numbered, limited to 500 on white wax. Vinyl orders come with instant digital download and are shipped 2-3 business days from date of purchase. Domestic orders are shipped via USPS Media Mail. International orders ship via First Class International.

Buy Digitally

name: Mutual Benefit + Holy Spirits - Mutual Spirits split 12"
description:
Mutual Spirits is a split vinyl 12" between Mutual Benefit (Boston, MA) and Holy Spirits (New York, NY). The idea for the split came about following shows both bands played in California in early 2010.

The 12" is pressed on white + gold swirl vinyl and is limited to 250. The album art is the creation of Nathaniel Whitcomb of Think or Smile. Vinyl orders come with instant digital download and are shipped 2-3 business days from date of purchase. Domestic orders are shipped via USPS Media Mail. International orders ship via First Class International.

Buy Digitally

2. Brownswan - mutual benefit

"Mutual Benefit on one side, giving us more childlike crooning. Holy Spirits on the other, making you contemplate religion again with their sacred sounds." -- Smoke Don't Smoke

name: Levek - Levek 7"
description:
David Levesque aka Levek has been crafting some incredible a capella meets Afrobeat meets Disney vibes for a while now and we became instant fans at first listen. You may have heard his killer Dirty Projectors or Grizzly Bear covers on a few of your favorite blogs.

The 7" is limited to 500, pressed on RED wax. Digital download includes two 7" songs + 3 bonus tracks. Vinyl orders come with instant digital download and are shipped 2-3 business days from date of purchase. Domestic orders are shipped via USPS Media Mail. International orders ship via First Class International.

Buy Digitally


"With the remarkable amount of musicianship packed into just three minutes, what's even more startling is how breezy it all feels. And then, when you open your eyes-- whether after the first or 50th listen-- the fact remains that this is almost completely the work of one person, and that fact never ceases to be very surprising." -- Pitchfork

"How one can make such complex, gorgeous and well-produced tunes by himself is really beyond me. David Levesque seems to have exactly what it takes to mastermind material the way Sufjan Stevens or Spencer Krug both do so well." -- I Guess I'm Floating

name: tooth ache. - Skin 7"
description:
Out now is the Skin 7" from Burlington, VT's tooth ache., the solo project of Alexandria Hall. Skin and B-side Lazarus are a hypnotic trip into tooth ache's dark, rhythmic pop jams.

The Skin 7" is limited to 400 on clear wax. Vinyl orders come with instant digital download and are shipped 2-3 business days from date of purchase. Domestic orders are shipped via USPS Media Mail. International orders ship via First Class International.

Buy Digitally

WATCH: "SKIN" OFFICIAL MUSIC VIDEO



"Self-described as "downer pop" but we're seeing a lot of silver lining" -- Impose Magazine

"Both weaving and baroque, tooth ache.'s "Skin" sounds like Our Constant Concern-era Mates of State being played by 2009's Beach House" -- 32ft/second

name: Family Trees - Dream Talkin 7"
description:
Dream Talkin is the debut 7" from Brooklyn's Family Trees. Their breezy tunes will make anyone dream of spur of the moment beach trips.

The 7" is limited to 500, pressed on clear wax. Vinyl orders come with instant digital download and are shipped 2-3 business days from date of purchase. Domestic orders are shipped via USPS Media Mail. International orders ship via First Class International.

Buy Digitally

WATCH: "No One Will Ever Know" Official Music Video (Directed by Amanda Finn)

1. Dream Talkin
2. Baby Come Back
3. No One Will Ever Know

"A lovely, lazy 1950s-feeling tune" -- Pitchfork

"The music from Family Trees is sincere, controlled, and has this unique aura that demands you give their sounds a spin. As far as new faces in 2010 are concerned, Family Trees is tops." -- We Listen For You
